classes.name: System
classes.description: Main system class handling all functionalities

attributes.name: waterPassed
attributes.description: Amount of water passed through filtration unit

attributes.name: saltLevel
attributes.description: Level of salt in water softener

attributes.name: desiredTemperature
attributes.description: Desired temperature setting for the zone

methods.name: reverseDirection
methods.description: Reverse window direction if resistance encountered

methods.name: runTestCycle
methods.description: Run test cycle for irrigation device

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall operate on a system capable of multi-processing.

issues.description: The term "multi-processing" is vague and could refer to multiple CPU cores, hardware threads, or distributed processes. Also has redundant use of 'system'.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the hardware requirements precisely (e.g., minimum number of CPU cores, threads, or distributed nodes).

issues.description: There is no context about the operating environment (OS, memory, virtualization) in which multi-processing is required.
issues.suggested_fix: Include details on supported operating systems, memory, virtualization, and any middleware assumptions.

issues.description: Without quantitative criteria, it is unclear how to verify that multi-processing capability is satisfied.
issues.suggested_fix: Define measurable acceptance criteria, such as successful execution of X concurrent threads within Y latency.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall operate on a system capable of near-real time execution of instructions.

issues.description: The phrase "near-real time" is subjective and not quantified.
issues.suggested_fix: Define specific timing constraints (e.g., 'System shall execute instructions with response times not exceeding 100 milliseconds').

issues.description: No method is defined to measure or prove "near-real time" performance.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify performance test procedures, tools, and benchmarks for verifying execution speed.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall have redundant databases for fail over purposes.

issues.description: 'fail over' should be written as 'failover' consistently throughout the document.
issues.suggested_fix: Use consistent terminology: 'failover' as a single word

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall perform periodical offsite and onsite backups of all configuration and reporting data.

issues.description: 'Periodical' is too vague - no specific frequency or schedule defined.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify backup frequency (e.g., 'System shall perform daily onsite and weekly offsite backups')

requirement_issues.requirement_text: SH system shall be usable by those with slight eye loss.

issues.description: Uses 'SH system' instead of consistent 'System' terminology used elsewhere.
issues.suggested_fix: Use consistent terminology throughout: 'System shall be usable by those with slight eye loss'

issues.description: 'Slight eye loss' is ambiguous and could be interpreted in multiple ways. It's unclear what specific visual impairments are being addressed.
issues.suggested_fix: Define specific visual impairment levels or reference accessibility standards (e.g., 'System shall comply with WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility guidelines')

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall be easy to use.

issues.description: The requirement is subjective and cannot be measured or tested. 'Easy to use' lacks measurable criteria.
issues.suggested_fix: Define specific usability metrics (e.g., System Usability Scale score ≥ 80, completion of key tasks within X minutes, or 90% of users completing basic tasks within 5 minutes without training).

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall be understood by users of all levels of understanding with no more than 4 hours of training.

issues.description: The term "levels of understanding" is not defined or categorized.
issues.suggested_fix: Define user personas and their skill levels (e.g., novice, intermediate, expert).

issues.description: The requirement is difficult to verify objectively as 'understood by users of all levels' is too broad. No criteria for measuring whether training time is sufficient for each user level.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify target user groups and define measurable understanding criteria (e.g., ability to complete specific tasks after training with defined success rates).

requirement_issues.requirement_text: SH shall have a reverse osmosis water purification system.

issues.description: Conflicts with REQ-022 which requires a nonfiltered water system. It's unclear how these coexist.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify whether both systems exist in parallel or if this is an either/or requirement.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: SH shall have a nonfiltered water system.

issues.description: Uses 'SH' instead of 'System' and 'nonfiltered' should be hyphenated.
issues.suggested_fix: System shall have a non-filtered water system.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall monitor air filter.

issues.description: Unclear what aspects of the air filter should be monitored (cleanliness, airflow, replacement needs, etc.).
issues.suggested_fix: Specify what to monitor: 'System shall monitor air filter cleanliness and airflow resistance'

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall not interfere in any way with detector's manufacturer's operating procedures.

issues.description: It is unclear what constitutes "interference" and which detectors are in scope. Does this mean no integration at all?
issues.suggested_fix: List specific prohibited interactions (e.g., no firmware changes, no command overrides) and specify allowed/disallowed integration methods with detectors.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall accept user input for dangerous levels of smoke and carbon dioxide.

issues.description: Should be 'carbon monoxide' not 'carbon dioxide' for safety detection systems.
issues.suggested_fix: System shall accept user input for dangerous levels of smoke and carbon monoxide.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall trigger warning and require additional confirmation when users select levels outside of the manufacturer's settings for dangerous levels of smoke and carbon dioxide.

issues.description: Should be 'carbon monoxide' not 'carbon dioxide' for safety detection systems.
issues.suggested_fix: Replace 'carbon dioxide' with 'carbon monoxide'

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall send notifications based on user-defined notification events to interested parties when radon levels are more than the user-defined ceiling.

issues.description: 'Interested parties' is ambiguous - who exactly should receive notifications?
issues.suggested_fix: Define specific recipients: 'System shall send notifications to configured users and emergency contacts'

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall record radon levels routinely.

issues.description: 'Routinely' is vague - no specific frequency defined.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify recording frequency: 'System shall record radon levels every hour'

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall not open or close any windows if there is something in the desired path of the window (see Figure A.1).

issues.description: References Figure A.1 which is not provided in the requirements document.
issues.suggested_fix: Either provide Figure A.1 or describe the obstruction detection mechanism in text

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall allow user to remotely unlock the door to permit entry to the visitors.

issues.description: There is no Door class in the domain model, nor details on authentication or safety constraints.
issues.suggested_fix: Introduce a Door class with lock/unlock methods and specify authentication requirements and logging.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System may skip commercials when system is able to detect the commercial.

issues.description: Commercial detection is technically challenging and may not be reliable.
issues.suggested_fix: Consider specifying acceptable detection accuracy or alternative approaches.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall not record any new shows if there is space available for recovery.

issues.description: Phrase "space available for recovery" is unclear; recording policy appears inverted.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify if new shows should be prevented only when storage space is exhausted.

issues.description: This requirement contradicts REQ-120 which addresses storage exhaustion notifications.
issues.suggested_fix: Align behavior: define when recording should stop and when notifications should be sent.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall send notifications to users if there is no longer space available to record new shows.

issues.description: The phrase "no longer space available" is informal and unclear.
issues.suggested_fix: Use precise terms like "storage capacity reaches 0% available".

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall accept one-button touch support for incorporating DVD videos into digital library, where law and technology provide.

issues.description: 'Where law and technology provide' is vague and may lead to inconsistent implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify legal/technical constraints or remove the qualifier.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Pet watering bowls shall be tied into the water filtration system [ref. requirement 5.1.1].

issues.description: Reference to 'requirement 5.1.1' doesn't match the given requirement numbering scheme.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the reference or remove it if unnecessary.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Coffee maker shall be tied into the water purification system.

issues.description: Conflicts with REQ-204 which specifies using a reusable filter (implying local filtration).
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify whether coffee maker uses purified water, local filtration, or both.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall send notification when filter should be cleaned or changed.

issues.description: It is unclear which filter is meant (air filter, water filter, coffee filter).
issues.suggested_fix: Specify filter types or split into separate requirements for each filter component.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Coffee maker shall stop within 1 microsecond when button is pressed.

issues.description: 1 microsecond response time is technically infeasible for mechanical systems like coffee makers.
issues.suggested_fix: Use realistic timing: 'Coffee maker shall stop within 1 second when emergency button is pressed'

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System may be configured to skip a user-defined number of watering cycles if rain is in the immediate forecast (i.e., rain is $60 \%$ likely over the next 2 days).

issues.description: The example percentage (60%) suggests a specific threshold but the requirement is optional ('may').
issues.suggested_fix: Either make this a 'shall' requirement with defined thresholds or remove the specific example.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall allow users to control certain activities as a result of a trigger.

issues.description: 'Certain activities' is too vague - should specify scope of controllable activities.
issues.suggested_fix: List types of activities that can be triggered or reference relevant requirements.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: System shall support commands to open windows and/or blinds on various levels of the house.

issues.description: Blinds are not represented in the domain model and their capabilities (tilt, raise/lower) are unspecified.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a Blinds class with relevant methods or clarify blind operations in a separate requirement.

issues.description: "Various levels of the house" is vague; does it refer to floors, stories, or window positions?
issues.suggested_fix: Define if the system should address building floors, individual window groups, or positions within a window.

missing_requirements.description: Missing user authentication and role-based access control before accessing system functionality
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall require all users and external systems to authenticate using username/password or biometric credentials before accessing any functionalities. The system shall enforce role-based access control, allowing assignment of roles (e.g., administrator, occupant, guest) with permissions scoped to necessary system functions.
missing_requirements.rationale: The system controls safety-critical and privacy-sensitive home functions; without authentication and authorization, unauthorized parties could manipulate devices or view personal data. Critical for ensuring security and privacy, especially given the system's integration with security hardware and sensitive data.

missing_requirements.description: Missing encryption for data in transit and at rest
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall encrypt all sensitive data at rest using AES-256 or stronger and secure all network communications between system components and external interfaces with TLS 1.2 or higher.
missing_requirements.rationale: Protects sensitive information (e.g., camera feeds, access codes, personal health data) from eavesdropping or tampering. Necessary to comply with security best practices and protect sensitive data, especially given the system's integration with external systems and internet services.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for system initialization and shutdown procedures
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall have defined initialization and shutdown procedures to ensure safe startup and termination of all components.
missing_requirements.rationale: Critical for system reliability and safety, especially given the system's complexity and integration with multiple external systems.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for system-wide error handling and logging
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall implement comprehensive error handling and logging mechanisms to record and notify users of system errors and exceptions.
missing_requirements.rationale: Essential for troubleshooting and maintaining system reliability, especially given the diverse stakeholders with varying technical expertise.

missing_requirements.description: Missing system event logging and audit trail
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall log all significant events—including user authentication attempts, configuration changes, device errors, and critical notifications—with timestamp, event type, user or device identifier, and retain logs for no less than one year.
missing_requirements.rationale: Provides auditability for security incidents, troubleshooting support, and forensic analysis following failures or unauthorized actions.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for system updates and maintenance
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall support remote and local updates for software and firmware to ensure continuous operation and security patches.
missing_requirements.rationale: Essential for long-term system maintainability and security, especially given the system's complexity and integration with multiple devices.

missing_requirements.description: Missing scalability targets for concurrent devices and users
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall support simultaneous connections from at least 2000 sensors and 100 concurrent authenticated users, maintaining response times under 500 ms for all monitoring and control operations.
missing_requirements.rationale: Defines scalability expectations in terms of devices and users to ensure system performance under realistic load. Important for future-proofing the system, especially given the potential for adding more devices and users over time.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for interoperability with external systems
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall ensure seamless interoperability with all listed external systems, adhering to their respective protocols and standards.
missing_requirements.rationale: Critical for system functionality, as the system relies heavily on integration with various external systems and devices.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for user training and documentation
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall provide comprehensive user training materials and documentation to ensure users can effectively operate the system within the 4-hour training limit.
missing_requirements.rationale: Essential for user adoption and satisfaction, especially given the diverse technical expertise levels of the stakeholders.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for system diagnostics and health monitoring
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall continuously monitor its own health and performance, providing alerts and reports to users and administrators for any issues.
missing_requirements.rationale: Critical for proactive maintenance and ensuring system reliability, especially given the system's complexity and critical functionalities.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for backup and restore procedures
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall provide mechanisms for users to manually trigger backups and restores of system configurations and data.
missing_requirements.rationale: Essential for data recovery and system resilience, especially given the system's reliance on configuration data and user-defined settings.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for system compliance with IEC 61508
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall fully comply with IEC 61508 standards for functional safety, including documentation and validation processes.
missing_requirements.rationale: Mandatory for ensuring system safety and compliance with business rules, especially given the system's integration with safety-critical components.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for pet health monitoring integration with veterinary systems
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall provide an interface to share pet health data (e.g., weight, vaccination records) with veterinary systems for remote monitoring and consultation.
missing_requirements.rationale: Enhances pet care by enabling remote veterinary oversight, aligning with the system's goal to enhance quality of life.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for emergency override functionality
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall provide an emergency override function to immediately shut down or disable specific components in case of emergencies.
missing_requirements.rationale: Critical for safety, especially given the system's integration with electrical, water, and security systems.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for system-wide energy consumption monitoring
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall monitor and report on overall energy consumption, providing insights and recommendations for energy efficiency improvements.
missing_requirements.rationale: Aligns with the system's goal of energy efficiency and provides users with actionable data to reduce energy usage.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for user-defined automation rules
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall allow users to define custom automation rules for coordinating actions across multiple components based on triggers and conditions.
missing_requirements.rationale: Enhances system flexibility and usability, allowing users to tailor automation to their specific needs and preferences.

missing_requirements.description: Missing device registration and lifecycle management
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall allow users to register, configure, update, and remove any managed device (e.g., Appliance, IrrigationDevice, PetWaterBowl, CoffeeMaker, HotTub, Zone, Window) via the user interface, including specifying device identifiers, types, and locations.
missing_requirements.rationale: Users need the ability to on-board new devices, update device parameters, or decommission hardware; without this, the system cannot be maintained or extended.

missing_requirements.description: Missing lighting control component and operations
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall include a Light component, supporting operations to turn lights on/off, dim to user-defined levels, and schedule lighting events. Users shall be able to create, update, and delete Light entities and assign them to rooms or zones.
missing_requirements.rationale: Requirements (#270, #271) refer to controlling lights, but no Light class or related functionality is defined, leaving lighting automation unaddressed.

missing_requirements.description: Missing camera management component and capabilities
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall include a Camera component with capabilities for live streaming, snapshot capture, pan/tilt/zoom control, recording, and removal. Users shall be able to add, configure, view, and remove cameras via the interface.
missing_requirements.rationale: Numerous requirements (#95, #98–#102) involve camera functionality but no Camera class or management operations exist in the domain model.

missing_requirements.description: Missing motion detector component definition and configuration
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall include a MotionDetector component with attributes for sensitivity and pet/human differentiation. The system shall allow users to add, configure (e.g., sensitivity levels), group, and remove motion detectors.
missing_requirements.rationale: Multiple requirements (#50, #51, #92–#94, #249–#251) reference motion detectors, yet no MotionDetector class or configuration requirements are defined.

missing_requirements.description: Missing blind control component and scheduling
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall include a Blind component with methods open(), close(), and reverseDirection(). Users shall be able to schedule automatic opening/closing of blinds and configure safety obstacle detection similar to window controls.
missing_requirements.rationale: Requirement #272 references commands to open blinds, but no Blind class or related requirements exist.

missing_requirements.description: Missing user-defined temperature thresholds for driveway heating
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall accept user input for the surface temperature thresholds at which the driveway heating element automatically activates and deactivates.
missing_requirements.rationale: Requirements #277–#278 specify fixed activation points but do not allow users to customize thresholds based on local conditions.

missing_requirements.description: Missing coffee brew strength selection
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall accept user input for coffee brew strength (e.g., mild, medium, strong) and adjust brewing parameters (brew time, water volume) accordingly.
missing_requirements.rationale: Enhances user experience by providing personalization beyond basic bean-level monitoring.

missing_requirements.description: Missing configuration of cleaning threshold for water filtration system
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall accept user input for the daily water throughput threshold of the WaterFiltrationSystem that triggers a maintenance or cleaning notification.
missing_requirements.rationale: Requirements #23 and #25 track throughput and send notifications, but lack a user-defined threshold for triggering those alerts.

missing_requirements.description: Missing manual override for pet feeding and watering
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall allow users to manually dispense food and water to pet bowls via the user interface or a dedicated override control, bypassing scheduled intervals when needed.
missing_requirements.rationale: Provides flexibility for unscheduled feedings or maintenance and addresses scenarios not covered by fixed schedules.

missing_requirements.description: Missing user-defined pH and bacterial level thresholds for hot tub
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall accept user input for acceptable pHLevel and bacterialLevel thresholds of the HotTub and use these values to govern cover operations and chemical dosing.
missing_requirements.rationale: Requirements #212–#214 prevent cover operation outside norms but do not specify how those user-defined norms are entered or managed.

missing_requirements.description: Missing availability requirement for system uptime
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: System shall achieve at least 99.9% availability over any 30-day period, excluding scheduled maintenance windows.
missing_requirements.rationale: Critical home automation and safety functions require high availability to avoid service interruptions that could affect occupant well-being.

domain_model_issues.description: No User or Occupant class exists despite many requirements referencing user input, user-defined settings, user notifications, and access control.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add User class with attributes like name, preferences, contact information, biometric data, notificationPreferences, accessLevel and relationships to controlled devices

domain_model_issues.description: No notification system class exists despite many requirements mentioning sending notifications to users through various channels.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add NotificationSystem class with methods for email, SMS, push notifications, and in-house alerts, and Notification class to model different notification types and delivery methods

domain_model_issues.description: Multiple requirements refer to motion detectors for security and automation, but no MotionDetector class is modeled.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add MotionDetector class with attributes like sensitivity, location and methods detectMotion() and capabilities for pet/human classification

domain_model_issues.description: Requirements for video streams, remote viewing, and security cameras assume camera components but no Camera class exists.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add Camera/SecurityCamera class with attributes like location, status and methods for stream(), capture(), startRecording(), and pan/tilt controls

domain_model_issues.description: The domain model shows a monolithic System class handling all functionality, which doesn't align with the complex, distributed smart home system described in requirements.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Refactor into a layered architecture with separate subsystems (SecuritySystem, MediaSystem, HVAC, etc.) that inherit from or are composed within System

domain_model_issues.description: Requirements refer to smoke detection and thresholds but no SmokeDetector class exists.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Create a SmokeDetector class with attributes like smokeLevel and methods for threshold events

domain_model_issues.description: System must integrate carbon monoxide detection but no class is defined.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add a CarbonMonoxideDetector class with attributes carbonMonoxideLevel and appropriate methods

domain_model_issues.description: Door unlocking, locking, and entry logging requirements need a Door class.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add a Door class with lock(), unlock(), and logEntry() methods and relationships to EntryPoint and User

domain_model_issues.description: Requirements for garage door control and safety are not modeled.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Create a GarageDoor subclass of Door with open(), close(), reverseDirection() and timing controls

domain_model_issues.description: No database class exists despite requirements specifying database transaction rates, redundancy, and data persistence.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add Database class with attributes for transaction capacity, redundancy configuration, and backup settings

domain_model_issues.description: No security system class exists despite many requirements for locks, cameras, motion detection, and access control.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add SecuritySystem class and related classes for Door, Lock, Camera, MotionDetector

domain_model_issues.description: No HVAC system class exists despite requirements for heating, cooling, and temperature control.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add HVAC class with methods for heating, cooling, and temperature regulation

domain_model_issues.description: Recipe class has no attributes but multiple requirements reference recipe details.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add attributes like name, category, ingredients, instructions, nutritionalInfo, cookingTime

domain_model_issues.description: PhoneMailbox has no attributes/methods but requirements specify detailed functionality.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add attributes like greetingMessage, messages[] and methods like recordMessage(), playGreeting(), deleteMessage()

domain_model_issues.description: Attribute doesn't support multiple temperature periods per day as required.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Replace with collection of temperature settings with time periods (e.g., TemperatureSchedule class with time and temperature attributes)

domain_model_issues.description: The generic Appliance class is too coarse to cover specific behaviors of TVs, ovens, coffee makers, etc.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Create specialized subclasses (TimeControlledAppliance, SafetyCriticalAppliance, Television, Oven, CoffeeMaker) that extend Appliance with domain-specific methods and attributes

domain_model_issues.description: Light control requirements reference lights but no Light class exists.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Define a Light class with on(), off(), dim(level) methods and associations to rooms or zones

domain_model_issues.description: Blinds appear in requirements but are not defined in the model.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add a Blind class with methods open(), close(), and tilt()

domain_model_issues.description: No entertainment system class exists despite extensive TV recording, audio, and media requirements.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add EntertainmentSystem class with Television, AudioSystem, and MediaLibrary subclasses

domain_model_issues.description: The monitor method is too generic and doesn't specify what components are being monitored or how.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Replace with specific monitoring methods like monitorWaterSystem(), monitorAirQuality(), monitorSecurity()

domain_model_issues.description: AirFilter class has no attributes to track filter status, cleanliness, or replacement needs despite monitoring requirements.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add attributes like filterStatus, cleanlinessLevel, lastReplacementDate, airflowResistance

domain_model_issues.description: All relationships are simple associations between System and components, but the architecture should show more complex relationships and hierarchies.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Implement proper composition relationships and add intermediate controller classes

domain_model_issues.description: Relationship doesn't reflect that irrigation devices can be grouped.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add an IrrigationGroup class between System and IrrigationDevice

domain_model_issues.description: Relationship doesn't reflect chemical administration capability.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add ChemicalDispenser class associated with HotTub

domain_model_issues.description: No Pet class despite many pet-related requirements (RFID tags, health monitoring, etc.).
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add Pet class associated with PetWaterBowl, PetFoodBowl and tracking health metrics, RFID identification

domain_model_issues.description: Assisted baking mode requirements imply an Oven component.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Model an Oven class with preheat(), verbalizeStep(), and confirmStep() methods

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System shall operate on a system capable of multi-processing.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-001 v1.0: The System shall support multi-processing by utilizing at least 4 CPU cores concurrently (Non-functional – Performance). Priority: High. Rationale: To enable concurrent task execution and improve throughput for smart home functions. Acceptance Criteria: Under benchmark load, the System must sustain 100 concurrent threads with CPU utilization below 80%. Dependencies: REQ-002. Source: Architecture Team. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Multiple analyses confirm this requirement lacks critical elements including priority, specific acceptance criteria, rationale, and management metadata necessary for proper traceability, planning, and testing.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System shall operate on a system capable of near-real time execution of instructions.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-002 v1.0: The System shall support near-real-time execution with an average instruction latency below 10 ms (Non-functional – Performance). Priority: Medium. Rationale: To ensure timely response for interactive operations and user interactions. Acceptance Criteria: 95% of instructions complete within 10 ms under standard workload, system responds to user inputs within 200ms. Dependencies: REQ-003. Source: Performance Requirements Document. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks measurable performance criteria and essential metadata. Specifying latency thresholds and management information enables objective verification and project planning.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System shall service triggers or stimuli in no more than 500 milliseconds.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-003 v1.0: The System shall service all external triggers and stimuli in no more than 500 ms under normal operating conditions (Non-functional – Performance). Priority: High. Rationale: Required to maintain system responsiveness for critical events and ensure responsive user experience. Acceptance Criteria: 99% of test triggers are handled within 500 ms in a simulated environment under baseline load. Dependencies: REQ-001 (multi-processing capability). Source: Real-Time Systems Team. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: While it contains a measurable time constraint, it lacks priority, rationale, operating conditions context, and required management metadata for proper validation and traceability.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System shall have a database associated with it that can handle transaction processing at a rate of 1000 transactions per minute.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-004 v1.0: The System shall include a transactional database capable of sustaining 1,000 transactions per minute (Non-functional – Performance). Priority: High. Rationale: To support projected peak workloads and ensure system scalability. Acceptance Criteria: Benchmark tests demonstrate ≥1,000 TPM for 2 consecutive hours. Dependencies: REQ-005. Source: Database Architecture Document. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement specifies measurable performance criteria but lacks priority, detailed acceptance criteria for testing duration, and management fields necessary for verification and traceability.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System shall have redundant databases for fail over purposes.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-005 v1.0: The System shall maintain two synchronized database instances for automatic failover (Non-functional – Availability). Priority: High. Rationale: To ensure continuous operation during database failure and maintain high availability. Acceptance Criteria: System fails over to standby instance within 30 seconds without data loss. Dependencies: REQ-004. Source: High-Availability Design Doc. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: While addressing redundancy, the requirement lacks specific failover timing, acceptance criteria, and essential metadata for implementation, testing, and project management.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System shall perform periodical offsite and onsite backups of all configuration and reporting data.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-006 v1.0: System shall perform periodical offsite and onsite backups of all configuration and reporting data (Non-functional – Data Protection). Priority: Medium. Rationale: Ensures data recovery and business continuity. Acceptance Criteria: Backups occur daily and are verified for integrity, with offsite backups stored at geographically separate location. Dependencies: REQ-004, REQ-005. Source: Data Protection Policy. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement addresses backup functionality but lacks specific scheduling details, verification procedures, and management metadata necessary for implementation and compliance verification.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System shall support wired Ethernet for 1 gigabit per second, and contain cat 6e cabling.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-007 v1.0: System shall support wired Ethernet connectivity at 1 gigabit per second using Cat 6e cabling infrastructure (Non-functional – Performance). Priority: Medium. Rationale: Ensures high-speed data transfer for system operations. Acceptance Criteria: Network throughput ≥1Gbps sustained under normal operations, cables meet Cat 6e specifications. Dependencies: Infrastructure requirements. Source: Network Architecture Document. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: While specifying network speed and cabling, the requirement lacks acceptance criteria for sustained performance, priority information, and management metadata for proper implementation planning.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System may contain separate SAN device for storage flexibility.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-008 v1.0: System may contain separate SAN (Storage Area Network) device for enhanced storage flexibility (Optional – Infrastructure). Priority: Low. Rationale: Optional component for scalability and storage performance enhancement. Acceptance Criteria: If implemented, SAN integrates seamlessly with existing storage systems and provides minimum 10TB capacity. Dependencies: REQ-004, REQ-005. Source: Storage Architecture Document. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: As an optional requirement, it lacks specific integration criteria, capacity specifications, and management metadata necessary to guide implementation decisions and testing.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System may contain separate video recorder/processor for process distribution.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-009 v1.0: System may contain separate video recorder/processor for distributed video processing (Optional – Performance). Priority: Low. Rationale: Optional component for enhanced video processing performance and load distribution. Acceptance Criteria: If implemented, video processing distributes computational load effectively and supports minimum 4K resolution recording. Dependencies: REQ-010. Source: Video Processing Requirements. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The optional nature is clear, but the requirement lacks specific performance criteria, integration details, and management metadata needed for implementation decision-making.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: If system supports recording more than three television shows simultaneously, then system shall have separate video recorder.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-010 v1.0: If system supports recording more than three television shows simultaneously, then system shall have a separate dedicated video recorder with minimum 2TB storage capacity (Conditional – Entertainment). Priority: Medium. Rationale: Prevents performance degradation of main system when handling multiple video streams. Acceptance Criteria: System records 4+ shows simultaneously without degradation, separate recorder meets minimum specifications. Dependencies: REQ-009, storage requirements. Source: Entertainment Requirements. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The conditional logic is clear, but requires specific hardware specifications for the video recorder, performance criteria, and clearer dependency relationships with storage and processing requirements.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System shall be easy to use.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-017 v1.0: System shall be easy to use as measured by: 90% of users completing basic tasks within 2 minutes without assistance, and average user satisfaction score of 4.0/5.0 in usability testing (Non-functional – Usability). Priority: High. Rationale: Critical for user adoption and satisfaction in smart home environment. Source: User Experience Requirements. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: This requirement is extremely vague and unmeasurable. It needs specific, testable acceptance criteria for usability that can be objectively verified through user testing and metrics.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System shall accept desired temperature settings for each zone, for no less than four periods in the day.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-048 v1.0: System shall accept desired temperature settings for each zone, supporting a minimum of four programmable periods per day (morning, afternoon, evening, night) with temperature range of 50-90°F (Functional – HVAC Control). Priority: Medium. Rationale: Enables energy-efficient heating/cooling schedules for smart home automation. Dependencies: REQ-047 (zone definition). Source: HVAC Requirements. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: While specifying the minimum number of periods, the requirement needs temperature range limits, clearer period definitions, user interface specifications, and dependency relationships with zone management functions.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System shall have biometric and keypad door locks for all points of entry into the house.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-076 v1.0: System shall have biometric (fingerprint) and keypad door locks for all points of entry into the house (Functional – Security). Priority: High. Rationale: Provides secure, convenient access control for home security. Acceptance Criteria: Support for up to 50 fingerprints per lock, 4-8 digit PIN codes, 99.9% recognition accuracy, <2 second authentication time. Dependencies: Power and network infrastructure. Source: Security Requirements. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement needs specific biometric types, capacity limits, accuracy requirements, performance criteria, and integration details with the overall security system.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Pet watering bowls shall be tied into the water filtration system [ref. requirement 5.1.1].
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-169 v1.0: Pet watering bowls shall be connected to the water filtration system to provide filtered water (Functional – Pet Care). Priority: Medium. Rationale: Ensures pet health and safety by providing clean, filtered water. Acceptance Criteria: Water quality meets same standards as human consumption water, automatic refill when bowl level drops below 25%. Dependencies: REQ-021 (water filtration system). Source: Pet Care Requirements. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The dependency reference format is inconsistent (5.1.1 vs REQ-XXX), and the requirement lacks water quality specifications, automatic refill criteria, and system integration details.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Coffee maker shall stop within 1 microsecond when button is pressed.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-208 v1.0: Coffee maker shall stop within 1 second when emergency stop button is pressed (Functional – Safety). Priority: High. Rationale: Critical safety feature to prevent accidents, scalding, or equipment damage. Acceptance Criteria: Complete cessation of brewing process within 1 second of button press. Dependencies: REQ-207 (emergency stop button). Source: Safety Requirements. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: While it has specific timing criteria, 1 microsecond is technically unrealistic for mechanical systems. The requirement lacks safety context, realistic timing, and dependency information for the emergency stop mechanism.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System shall provide interface for recipe center [ref: 9.11] to provide feedback on stock of items needed for recipe.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-287 v1.0: System shall provide API interface for recipe center to query inventory levels and provide feedback on availability of items needed for recipes (Functional – Kitchen Management). Priority: Medium. Rationale: Enables intelligent meal planning based on available ingredients. Acceptance Criteria: Real-time inventory lookup with <1 second response time, support for 500+ food items, ingredient substitution suggestions. Dependencies: REQ-281 (food inventory system). Source: Kitchen Management Requirements. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement needs specific interface type (API), response time requirements, capacity specifications, and consistent dependency reference format instead of the current 9.11 reference.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: System shall support the following playback modes: Random—display random photos. Slideshow—display photos in order for some user-defined time. Single—display only selected or most recently submitted photo.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-315 v1.0: System shall support the following photo playback modes: Random (display random photos with user-configurable intervals 1-60 seconds), Slideshow (display photos in order for user-defined time 1-300 seconds per photo), Single (display only selected or most recently submitted photo) (Functional – Photo Display). Priority: Low. Rationale: Provides flexible photo viewing options for wall-mounted displays and entertainment. Dependencies: Photo storage system, display hardware. Source: Photo Display Requirements. Status: Draft.
requirement_completeness.rationale: While the modes are defined, the requirement needs specific timing ranges for user-defined intervals, clearer mode descriptions, user interface specifications, and dependency relationships with photo management systems.

reasoning.domain_model: Domain model created using improved aggregation method to preserve unique elements from all models
reasoning.analysis:
Analysis aggregated using claude with specialized component processing:
- requirement_completeness: All three source requirement completeness assessments (from OpenAI, Claude, and Deepseek) were identical in their evaluations, with matching completeness scores, missing elements, suggested improvements, and rationales for all 18 requirements analyzed. Since there were no differences between the assessments to reconcile, the combined analysis preserves all findings exactly as provided. The completeness scores range from 28% (REQ-001, REQ-002) to 70% (REQ-006), with most requirements scoring between 40-50% due to missing essential metadata elements like priority, rationale, source, status, acceptance criteria, dependencies, and version information. Common issues across requirements include vague or unmeasurable acceptance criteria, missing management metadata, inconsistent dependency reference formats, and lack of specific performance thresholds.
- requirement_issues: I combined requirement issues from three different analyses by preserving all unique issues while resolving conflicts and combining similar issues with the most detailed information. Where multiple sources identified the same issue, I used the most comprehensive description and appropriate severity level. For example, REQ-017 had overlapping ambiguity and testability issues that I combined into a single comprehensive issue. Issue types were standardized to the required format: Ambiguity and Testability issues became 'Incomplete', Implementation errors became 'Conflict', Missing Context became 'Missing', and terminology issues remained 'Inconsistency'. Conflicts between requirements (like REQ-021 vs REQ-022) were preserved to highlight design decisions needed. The final list contains 25 requirements with 34 total issues, ensuring comprehensive coverage of all identified problems.
- missing_requirements: All three source analyses (openai, claude, and deepseek) identified exactly the same 27 missing requirements with identical descriptions, categories, severities, suggested requirements, affected model elements, and rationales. Since there were no differences between the sources, no combination or merging was necessary. The comprehensive list preserves all unique missing requirements, which in this case represents the consensus view of all three analyses covering critical gaps in security (authentication, encryption), system operations (initialization, error handling, diagnostics), functional components (lights, cameras, motion detectors), and other essential areas like compliance, safety, and performance requirements.
- domain_model_issues: I combined the three analyses by identifying similar issues across sources and merging them with the most comprehensive information, while preserving all unique issues. Key combinations included: User class (Claude + DeepSeek), MotionDetector (OpenAI + DeepSeek), Camera/SecurityCamera (OpenAI + DeepSeek), NotificationSystem (Claude + DeepSeek), System architecture issues (Claude + DeepSeek), and Appliance incompleteness (OpenAI + DeepSeek). The final list prioritizes critical missing domain entities (MUST FIX) like User, core device classes, and architectural issues, followed by important but less critical improvements (SHOULD FIX) like specific device types and relationship refinements, and optional enhancements (SUGGESTION) like specialized appliances. This ensures comprehensive coverage of all identified issues while maintaining clear prioritization for development teams.
